title: I guess I forgot to post this
content:
Did this for a contest on Pixeljoint a while back. The rules were to pixel a famous character but as the opposite sex. I was busy that week so I couldn't really participate as well as I wanted, so I just whipped up a quick picture on the last day before the deadline just for fun.

[img]http://dylanimages.googlepages.com/baileablaze2.gif[/img]
16 colors, EGA palette

Oh, and wouldn't you know it, I would soon find out, that by sheer coincidence, someone had the same idea I did:
[url=http://pixeljoint.com/pixelart/22611.htm]pixeljoint.com/pixelart/22611.htm[/url][center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

content:

title: hmm.
content:
I prefer my Keen to be a little boy. :P

Edit, to not sound so negative: I like the way you shape your helmets, allstories.

title: Re: hmm.
content:
Haha, weird. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But well drawn no doubt about that.

And the linked pic -- wow, great quality, reminds a bit (or maybe it's just me) of Keen GBC box art style.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: I guess I forgot to post this
content:
Hehe. That's different. Well crafted. I still find attempted photo-realism using an EGA palette somewhat nauseating, but it's great just to see the art form alive and well. Your dithering and curve shaping are most excellent, as always!

The face still looks somehow masculine, though.

title: Re:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]protagonized[hr][/quote]

Is that a word?

title: Hmm.
content: Good question. I'd vote yes, as it's a different form of a recognizable word. You're an actor, the play is acted by you; you're a protagonist, the game is protangonized by you... Because you can't be an Actist, and you can't be a Protaginator.

title: Re: Hmm.
content: Also, since antagonize is a word.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Point!
content: Dang, man, that was a thousand times more eloquent than my explanation.

title: Re: Point!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr] New Post hmm. I prefer my Keen to be a little boy. :P
[hr][/quote]

For some reason (Keen's white skin perhaps?) that reminded me of Michael Jackson.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Point!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Is that a word?[hr][/quote]
It doesn't matter if it is a word, the right word, or if it is even spelled correctly. If it gets my point across... it works for me.
Most of the time I don't so my words just fail. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] -----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Point!
content:
A word can be a word if you give it meaning, even if it's not widely known or accepted, no?____________

title: Re: Point!
content:
I know.

Wow, it seems there is no English verb for "the action of being a protagonist in an artistic thingy". Or at least, I can't find it.

I must admit, the picture that allstories linked in the form of a forum thread is way... better than his one.
